awd_titl_txt: Foreign Language Tutoring and Learning Environment
awd_abstract_narration: In this collaboration, investigators from GMU and MIT will pursue               a computational tutoring and learning environment for foreign                   language learning.  GMU will enhance its naturalistic, immersion-               style foreign language experience.  Based on the premise that                   language is most thoroughly and memorably learned in the course                 of meaningful use, this system integrates dialogue and rich                     graphical interaction in the context of everyday scenes.  The MIT               group has over four years built extensive theory-based natural                  language processing software with language independent semantics                and multi-level error handling especially designed for tutorial                 purposes.  The collaboration will have important research                       benefits in both directions.  The MIT language software will                    greatly enhance the GMU immersion system and permit a proper                    study of its efficacy.  The error diagnosis capabilities will                   permit an investigation of student modeling, with potential long-               term consequences for the study of both intelligent tutoring                    systems and psycholinguistics.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
